div.l: Vnto the bed ther as the myller lay
He wend haue cropyn in by his felaw Iohn
And by the Miller in he crepte anon
And caught hym by the nekke and softe he spake
He saide thou Iohn thou swynys hede a wake
For cristes sowle and her a noble game
For by that lord that callid is seinte iame
As h h I haue thries in this schorte nyght
Swyuyd the Milleres doughtir bolt vp right
While thou ase a coward hast ben agast
Ye false harlot quoth the Miller hast
Thou schalte be dede bi goddis dignite
How dorste thou be so bolde to disꝑparage
My doughtir that is come of sowch lynage
And by the throte bolle he caught alayn
And he hente hym dispitously agayn
And on the nose he smot hym with his fist
Doun Ranne the blody strem vpon his breste
And in the flore with nose and mouth to broke
They walwe as don the piggis in a poke
And vp they gon and doun agayn a non
Til that the Miller spurnyd at a ston
And doun he fille bakward on his wif
That wist nothing of this nyce strife
For sche was falle a slepe a litill wight
With Iohn the clerke that wakyd had al nyght
And with the fall oute of hir slepe sche breide
Helpe holy crosse of bromholm sche seide
In manus tuas to the lord I calle
A wake Symonde the fende is on me fall
Myn herte is brokyn help I nam but ded
Ther lith on my wombe and on myn hed
Help Symkyn now / the false clerkis fight
This Iohn starte up as faste as eủere he myght
And graspith by the wallis to and froo
To fynde a staf and sche stirte vp also
And knew the estres bet than did Iohn
And by the walle a staffe sche fond a non
And sawe a litill schymeryng of a light
For at an hole in schone the mone bright
And bi that light sche saw hem bothe too
But sikirly sche ne wist who was hoo
But as sche sawe a whit thing in hir iȝe
